data.title: Kimchi
ingredients: 2 tablespoons fish sauce (or soy sauce for a vegetarian option)
steps: Cut the Napa cabbage into quarters and remove the core. Slice the cabbage into bite-sized pieces.
In a large bowl, toss the cabbage with sea salt, ensuring it's evenly coated. Let it sit for 1-2 hours to soften.
After the cabbage has softened, rinse it thoroughly under cold water to remove excess salt. Drain well and gently squeeze out any excess water.
In a separate bowl, mix together minced garlic, minced ginger, sugar, gochugaru, and fish sauce (or soy sauce). Adjust the spice level to your preference by adding more or less gochugaru.
Add the chopped green onions and optional julienned carrot to the cabbage. Toss with the spice paste, making sure the cabbage and vegetables are well coated.
Pack the kimchi mixture tightly into a clean jar, leaving some space at the top. Seal the jar and let it ferment at room temperature for 1-2 days.
Refrigerate the kimchi. It will continue to ferment slowly in the fridge and develop more flavor over time.

data.title: Udon Noodles
steps: Cook the udon noodles according to package instructions. Drain and set aside.
In a pan, heat some oil over medium heat. Add sliced onions, bell peppers, and any other vegetables of your choice. Stir-fry until tender.
Add the cooked udon noodles to the pan.
Pour in soy sauce and a splash of mirin or sake. Toss everything together until well combined and heated through.
Optional: Add cooked protein such as chicken, beef, or tofu, and stir to combine.
Garnish with chopped green onions and sesame seeds. Serve hot.

data.title: Pad Thai
steps: Soak rice noodles in hot water according to package instructions until softened. Drain and set aside.
In a wok or large skillet, heat oil over medium-high heat. Add minced garlic and diced tofu or shrimp, and cook until the protein is cooked through.
Push the protein to one side of the pan and crack an egg into the empty space. Scramble and cook until just set.
Add the soaked noodles, tamarind paste, fish sauce, and a bit of sugar. Stir everything together until the noodles are well coated and heated through.
Toss in bean sprouts and chopped green onions.
Serve with lime wedges and crushed peanuts on the side.

data.title: Bánh Mì
steps: Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C). Slice baguettes lengthwise, but do not cut all the way through.
Spread mayonnaise and pâté (if using) on the inside of each baguette.
Layer in cooked pork, pickled daikon and carrots, and fresh cucumber slices.
Add fresh cilantro and sliced jalapeños to taste.
Close the baguettes, slice into portions, and serve immediately or wrap for later.

data.title: Orange Chicken
ingredients: Chicken breasts, cut into bite-sized pieces
steps: Cut chicken breasts into bite-sized pieces and toss with cornstarch.
Heat oil in a pan over medium-high heat. Fry the chicken pieces in batches until golden brown and cooked through. Remove and drain on paper towels.
In the same pan, sauté garlic and ginger until fragrant.
Add orange juice, soy sauce, sugar, and a splash of vinegar. Simmer until the sauce thickens.
Return the chicken to the pan and toss to coat with the orange sauce.
Garnish with sliced green onions and sesame seeds.
Serve with rice.

data.title: Fried Rice
steps: Cook rice according to package instructions and let it cool. Day-old rice works best for fried rice.
Heat oil in a large skillet or wok over medium-high heat. Add diced onions, carrots, and peas. Stir-fry until vegetables are tender.
Push the vegetables to one side of the pan and scramble a couple of eggs in the empty space.
Add the cold rice to the pan, breaking up any clumps.
Stir in soy sauce and optional protein (chicken, shrimp, or tofu).
Continue to stir-fry until everything is well combined and heated through.
Garnish with chopped green onions.

data.title: Bibimbap
ingredients: Assorted vegetables (e.g., spinach, carrots, zucchini, mushrooms)
steps: Cook rice according to package instructions.
Prepare and cook assorted vegetables (e.g., spinach, carrots, zucchini, mushrooms) and set aside.
For each vegetable, season with a bit of sesame oil, soy sauce, and garlic, then sauté or blanch as needed.
Fry an egg sunny side up or to your preference.
In a bowl, place a serving of rice and arrange the cooked vegetables and egg on top in separate sections.
Add a dollop of gochujang (Korean red chili paste).
Mix everything together before eating.

data.title: Shoyu Ramen
steps: Prepare the ramen noodles according to package instructions. Drain and set aside.
In a pot, combine chicken or pork broth with soy sauce, mirin, and a bit of sugar. Bring to a simmer.
Add sliced mushrooms, bamboo shoots, and cooked protein (such as pork or chicken) to the broth. Simmer until the vegetables are tender.
Divide the cooked noodles between bowls.
Ladle the hot broth and toppings over the noodles.
Garnish with sliced green onions, nori (seaweed), and a soft-boiled egg.
Serve hot.
